Reviews.Title: “Quaint, charming, great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: bristolbakedalaska
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay in this hotel. The vaporetto stop is 2 seconds away (San Angelo) and San Marco square a 10 min walk, so it's really central. The room and hotel was clean and the staff warm and welcoming. We had roopm 14 which had a beautiful romantic view of a canal. Would 100% stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Quite the rudest people I have met in italy”
Reviews.Author: SteveLaveno
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Italy for 15 years and have never felt so affronted or unwelcome as when I walked in the reception of this hotel just now. I am not a guest of the hotel, but now never will be - I was politely asking whether I could book a water taxi to pick up from here in the morning, but was told that since I wasn't a guest, I could basically get stuffed. Classy. It's ok to say no, or I don't know, but to be told to get lost by a hotel management is the pits. There are plenty of great places to stay in Venice, and some great people too, so my advice would be is that if is house they treat visitors, go anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A warm welcome to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Unexpectedtraveller
Reviews.Content: I had to make an unexpected emergency trip to Venice to assist a sick relative so I was under significant stress. The management and staff could not have been kinder or more helpful. They really went out of their way to help me during a difficult time. The hotel itself is very well situated and clean and comfortable. It has all the basic amenities and is a charming introduction to Italy and its people. I definately plan to return, but this time for a holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotel, with Venetian charm and amazing rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Andy_Edit
Reviews.Content: Spent a 2 night stay here following a recommendation by the Hotel information office at PiazzalÃ© Roma. At first i thought â‚¬120 a night for the room was too pricey, but for Venice and for the location, i realised afterwards that it was quite a good deal. We had the romantic, old fashioned room overlooking the canal (see hotel's photos). It was like staying in a museum (in a positive way). You had the lovely feeling that you were in Venice 200 years ago. If you stay here, you must have this room! The downside was that gaps in the door and windows meant that you did hear people talking and walking outside the hotel (in the streets) and in the corridor(inside the hotel). However, it didn't ruin the stay, we were there for sightseeing, not sleeping. If you need a 10 hour sleep, dont stay here. I read the other reviews on Trip Advisor and can only conclude that they have changed the staff. They were lovely and friendly, even the lady that couldn't speak english well, made a real effort and was so apologetic that her english wasn't so good. The Filipino guy on night duty was also happy and helpful, always smiling and cheerful when he let you in at night (they lock the doors after a certain time). Breakfast was simple, but the non english speaking waitress was also great - so, no complaints at all on the staff. The hotel is a bit dated and tired, but we loved it.. It oozed Venetian charm.

Reviews.Title: “Very Rude Personnel”
Reviews.Author: elpidoforos
Reviews.Content: Asked the hotel's reception for information in a rainy day and they wouldn't even bother to look at me - avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miffed-from-West-Mid
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Very well situated between San Marco and Rialto Bridge. Waterbus stop just around the corner. Buy 3 day passes and save a fortune. Rooms very comfortable. Service excellent. We had a room overlooking a canal. You won't go far wrong staying here. There is so much to see and do in Venice. If you enjoy shopping you'll be in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Centrehouse
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in L'alboro yes it was expensive but this is Venice. It is about 50 meters from the local 'bus stop S Angelo' the one after the Rialto and the water bus from the airport will take you directly to the stop make sure you get the right one as there are at least 2 and they do not go to all stops. We had room 7 which seemed to be the one to go for as it is large and has a balcony looking over a canal and good air conditioning. The breakfast is basic but adequate - cereal, yoghurt bread ham and cheese It is about 10 minutes to St Marks square and also to the Rialto bridge. There are 3 restaurants which are good within 5 minutes. No English channnel on the TV. Overall for Venice we were happy with the hotel room and location

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de l'Alboro
HotelInfo.Address: San Marco 3894B | Corte dell'Alboro, 30124 Venice, Italy
